definition: to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag

sentences.english: Many American statestaunttout themselves as fishing and hunting paradises, and with good reason.
sentences.chinese: 許多美國州自詡是釣魚打獵的天堂，而且理由很充分。

sentences.english: Blair was a self-styled regular guy with buckets of charm.
sentences.chinese: 布萊爾風度翩翩，自詡爲受歡迎的人。
組織者自詡此次演出爲“畢生難逢的體驗”。

sentences.english: Saddam, who bragged that the Babylonian lion on behalf of Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 薩達姆自詡爲巴比倫的雄獅在此代表伊拉克。

sentences.english: China boasts that more countries are taking part in Shanghai's Expo than any in history.
sentences.chinese: 中國自詡上海世博會參展國數史上第一。

sentences.english: They love to boast, though often with tongue in cheek. P. 3
sentences.chinese: 他們喜歡吹噓自詡，儘管往往是半開玩笑，不可當真。

sentences.english: It is time for the CPC who boast himself to be great, glorious and correct to wake up.
sentences.chinese: 忠言逆耳，一貫自詡偉大光榮正確的中共，該醒了。

sentences.english: She poses as an expert in old coins.
The man boasted himself to be of noble origin.
Well,some of them claimed to be by apostles.
sentences.chinese: 它們中有些自詡爲使徒所寫。
